meanings.definition: Occurring in turn; succeeding each other in a regular sequence.
meanings.sent1: The team had an alternate plan in case the first one failed.
meanings.sent2: The students took alternate seats on the bus for the field trip.
meanings.sent3: The alternate route to the park was through the scenic forest.
meanings.sent4: Her mood seemed to alternate between joy and sadness throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The colors on the butterfly's wings were an alternate pattern of black and orange.

meanings.definition: To take turns; to interchange regularly.
meanings.sent1: The friends alternate choosing the movie they will watch.
meanings.sent2: They alternate between walking and running during their exercise routine.
meanings.sent3: The siblings alternate teasing each other playfully.
meanings.sent4: The sun and clouds alternate in the sky, creating a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent5: The birds alternate singing their melodies in the early morning.

meanings.sent1: She brought an alternate snack to share at the party.
meanings.sent2: The alternate for the lead role in the play had to step in last minute.
meanings.sent3: The alternate for the missing ingredient was quickly found in the pantry.
meanings.sent4: His alternate for the meeting couldn't make it, so he had to attend himself.
meanings.sent5: The alternate for the broken toy was a similar one that brought just as much joy.

meanings.definition: To happen or exist in a repeated pattern.
meanings.sent1: The seasons alternate throughout the year, bringing different weather.
meanings.sent2: The colors on the flag alternate between red and white stripes.
meanings.sent3: The lights alternate between bright and dim in the dance club.
meanings.sent4: The waves alternate in their intensity, calming and crashing rhythmically.
meanings.sent5: The flavors in the dish alternate between sweet and savory, creating a unique taste.
